intro: [WRONG START] Citrullus vulgarus var. depressus, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a unique variant of the bottle gourd family. It is characterized by its thick, warty skin that ranges in color from green to orange, often with a textured, spiky appearance. The plant produces large, inflated fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and typically have a rough texture. This variety is primarily cultivated for its edible fruit, which has a mild, slightly sweet flavor.
